type, name, score description image
[Manga]
(Hunter x Hunter)
8.1/10 		its fun and has pretty dark themes considering it is a shonen. kind of repetitive in some arcs though.
[Manga]
(Homunculus)
5.3/10 		wow this is pretty coo- AUUGGUIFAA AAAAHHHH IAISODADOJOJOGF BNBMVMFIADKADKDFLLGF AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA AHFHHHHHHHHajffhjf :( cool story but sometimes gets so disgusting i have to take a multiple day break from reading it
[Manga]
(Blue Period)
8.7/10 		great story with interesting character development especially because his development is a lot more abstract then other stories, also how is the most hot girl actually and a man. my only issues are that at some stages it gets kind of boring and also later on it creates characters that seem unrealistic and kind of one dimensional (granted ive never been to art school) but for a world set in our world the characters just seem a little too eccentric.
[Manga]
(JoJo's Bizarre Adventure Part 8: Jojolion)
8.4/10 		not on the same level as the previous part but jojolion still has intriguing story and an interesting mystery even if the villain isnt very good especially when you compare him to valentine. on a side note no matter how much ariki tries to pretend the jojos are straight they are clearly all raging homosexuals jousuke got a boner when he looked behind yasuho and saw joushu im telling you.
[Manga]
(Grappler Baki)
7.5/10 		baki is not a good story in almost any way, not art, characters or story but it makes up for that with pure entertainment value. baki is some of the most insane, bizarre and entertaining shit that anyones ever made. my eyes stayed stuck to this shit stained page the entire time. no image
[Manga]
(Helck)
8.3/10 		an entertaining twist on the average fantasy world
[Manga]
(The Girl From the Other Side)
8.4/10 		great art style with a old fashioned picture book kind of vibe that makes every page interesting to look at. an interesting world and the curse is a cool idea. i liked all of the cast. my only issues with it is that it felt as if it ended a bit sooner then i would have liked. i think it needed more time to flesh out its ideas and so the ending would make more sense because reading the ending was really confusing (or i might just be stupid) but even with confusing buts once i fully understood it i think it was a decent conclusion.
[Manga]
(Vinland Saga)
9.1/10 		the art is stunning the characters are interesting, especially askeladd and thorfinn who both are horrible people who have done horrible things but you cant help but enjoy their presences. thorkell is also really entertaining to watch and is basically a dorohedoro character. my only gripes with this series are that it feels so grounded in reality that when a silly manga moment or something outlandish happens it really takes me out of it and that the whole idea of having no enemies just seems too idealistic in such a realistic world.
[Manhwa]
(Something About Us)
5.4/10 		i usually read shit romance to relax me and to burn time. i love to complain about romance manhwa and manga being shit but if they get too good i just dont read them. this did most things well but tragically i hated almost everyone and it was a bit miserable at times so it definitely didnt relax me. its a pretty good read if you like romance as a genre but if youre like me its kind of a slog to get through. no image
[Manga]
(20th Century Boys)
9/10 		great start and its really cool when you understand every part of it. the art and panelling are great and urasawa makes everything cinematic. i like almost all of the cast especially otcho and his journey. the story kind of drags but i was still interested the whole time. the ending was a massive fumble in my opinion even if you include 21st century boys as the same manga, prior to the ending i considered 20th century boys to be a high 9 maybe even a 10 but if you dont include 21st century boys i would say it becomes an 8. even including 21st century boys its still only a low 9 as i found the final reveal dissatisfying and i still had questions left.
[Manga]
(Arakawa Under the Bridge)
4.6/10 		it was pretty funny sometimes but every chapter is like 8 pages with one joke per and there are more than 400. i breezed through the first 100 but it got really repetitive, similar issues that i felt with komi cant communicate.
[Manhwa]
(A Business Proposal)
5.3/10 		its another predictable romance manhwa. the art is fine, the story is nothing special but its not that bad just not my cup of tea and the characters are fine as well but it entertained me enough to finish it also my brother saw me reading this and now i think he thinks of me as less of a man. its easy to skim as well and i think i got about the same experience with a quarter of the reading. i think her brother is also a closet homosexual because like he didnt know it was a girl, he was just into a guy.
[Manga]
(One Piece)
7.8/10 		honestly the more one piece i read the more just fatigued i feel. i just cant love a series that has no stakes, nobody ever dies and i know death isnt the only way to build stakes but one piece is the kind of story where death should happen, its a bunch of pirates shooting at each other in a sea where if the mc falls in he dies and it feels like oda pulling it out his ass when somehow everyone survives. how am i meant to care about massive fights when i know the characters could just wait a week after then do it again. i still think one piece is a good manga but i dont think its as great as i first thought when i had only read 100 chapters.
[Manga]
(The Climber)
10/10 		the start of the climber is bad, like 4/10 type writing completely carried by the art where there is zero subtlety with anything, like straight up the teacher says 'could it be something in his past that made him shut his heart'. it had bad pacing like they said that mori is changing after knowing him for like 2 weeks and it felt slow and fast at the same time somehow so i probably would have dropped this but apparently after volume 3 the original author left and the artist had to do his job for him, and the artist immediately killed off most of the side characters literally or by turning them into whores. he changed the plot from a sports manga to a psychological manga with climbing as a backdrop to it with a massive amount of symbolism and the art kept getting better and better and by the final climb it had reached a peak as high as even berserk and vagabond in my opinion. the final climb was probably my favourite arc and ending in all of manga and hit so hard not knowing if he would live or die until the very end. i did not move for the entire duration of it. this is peak literally and figuratively (im a comedic genius).
[Manhwa]
(My Boss's Special Request)
4.6/10 		how did they fit bad characters with a loser mc who complains too much, a boring plot, bad comedy, found time to fit in a cliche why is my heart beating so fast scene and had him defend the boss from trash talk less than 10 chapters after he did the same thing all in a single package? the only saving grace from this dropping any lower is that the side plot about the celebrity guy getting 0 bitches was pretty funny and also you can read 40 chapters of it in like an hour.
[Manga]
(Akumetsu)
8.4/10 		action packed with a protagonist that is fun to watch, has actual goals and a code of conduct with great art and some of the most creative scenes ive ever seen. only problem is that this is a criticism of the japan when it was released and its getting pretty old having ended in 2006 and also im not japanese so it takes a little bit of research for some it to make sense (also the one man one kill thing is kind of true but they are all the same guy so its debatable but its fine i guess).
[Manhwa]
(Everyone Else is A Returnee)
3.3/10 		such a cool premise and then they just played it for laughs even though they werent funny. usually i read something bad but entertaining to relax after reading intense shit like berserk but this just made me more angry. no image
[Manga]
(Death Note)
7.9/10 		this is like playing multiple separate games of 5d chess except you cant see the board, all the chess pieces are just grey rectangles, you cant see what your opponent is doing and just have to guess and if you move wrong once you die but also sometimes some random girl snaps either your board or your opponents board in half and destroys all your pieces
[Manga]

[Manga]
(Berserk)
10/10 		i dont know how to explain this but the swings feel so real in berserk, like i can feel them and can tell when guts gets stronger just by how impactful his swings are and i hear an audible boom anytime he swings dragon slayer, you see the wind up and then just destruction, no wind up, just slow and deliberate movements and then the explosion of whoever he was fighting. the eclipse was actually peak like it got built up so well by people talking about it so you knew it was bad and then it happened and holy shit it was just as bad as they built up to.
